sentences.text: Description     : A Python solitaire game collection
"PySolFC is a collection of more than 1000 solitaire card games.
It is a fork of PySol Solitaire.

There are games that use the 52 card International Pattern deck,
        games for the 78 card Tarock deck, eight and ten suit Ganjifa
        games, Hanafuda games, Matrix games, Mahjongg games, and games
        for an original hexadecimal-based deck.

Its features include modern look and feel (uses Tile widget set),
        multiple cardsets and tableau backgrounds, sound, unlimited undo,
        player statistics, a hint system, demo games, a solitaire wizard,
        support for user written plug-ins, an integrated HTML help browser,
        and lots of documentation."
Even original author of PySol recommends this fork:

"As of 2008 any work on PySol has stopped, and PySol is officially
        discontinued.

Fortunately a number of enthusiastic people have continued from
        where I left off and have created the PySol Fan Club edition.

Please contribute all your patches and enhancements to this new
        project."
I've just uploaded a version to REVU:
Bernhard, please continue the process of adding pysolfc to debian.

Is it 
hard to find a sponsor?

When you do, be sure to also add a transitional package called pysol which 
depends on the new one, to give a good upgrade path.

I'd hate for pysol{fc} to not be in debian anymore, it's a better 
solitaire than any of the others.
> Bernhard, please continue the process of adding pysolfc to debian.

Is it 
> hard to find a sponsor?

though I have to admit that I found
out about the Games Team's git repository very recently;

I've just
finished adding pysolfc and pysolfc-cardsets to it.

But I still don't
have any sponsor...

> When you do, be sure to also add a transitional package called pysol which 
> depends on the new one, to give a good upgrade path.
I'd sure do, but don't really know how.

Can you give me any hints or
pointers?
On Tue, 7 Sep 2010, Bernhard Reiter wrote:
>> Bernhard, please continue the process of adding pysolfc to debian.

Is it
>> hard to find a sponsor?

though I have to admit that I found
> out about the Games Team's git repository very recently;

I've just
> finished adding pysolfc and pysolfc-cardsets to it.

But I still don't
> have any sponsor...

Send an email to debian-mentors@lists.debian.org - or subscribe first: 
http://lists.debian.org/debian-mentors/
RFS: pysolfc (replacement for removed package: pysol)

>> When you do, be sure to also add a transitional package called pysol which
>> depends on the new one, to give a good upgrade path.
> I'd sure do, but don't really know how.

Can you give me any hints or
> pointers?
You create an empty package, containing just the control file.
Description: transitional package from pysol to pysolfc
Package to ease upgrading from older pysol to new pysolfc.
This package can be purged once pysolfc has been installed.

> Send an email to debian-mentors@lists.debian.org - or subscribe first: 
> http://lists.debian.org/debian-mentors/
Thx, I've already prepared that mail.

> >> When you do, be sure to also add a transitional package called pysol which
> >> depends on the new one, to give a good upgrade path.
> You create an empty package, containing just the control file.

fields to pysolfc, which would somehow collide with that transitional
pysol.

I've tentatively added (<< 2.0-1~) to those field entries, but
unfortunately, latest pysol versions were higher (e.g.
Thanks for your help, it's very much appreciated!
On Thu, 16 Sep 2010, Bernhard Reiter wrote:

> fields to pysolfc, which would somehow collide with that transitional
> pysol.

I've tentatively added (<< 2.0-1~) to those field entries, but
> unfortunately, latest pysol versions were higher (e.g.
pysol and pysolfc don't have to be the same version.

pysol (the transitional) must have a version number greater than any that 
have ever been uploaded.
And include an empty, separate, package for pysol.

pysol should not 
be part of the same source as pysolfc).
(Note the extra packages I added to the conflicts.)
Use the epoch field of versions
pysolfc would be version 1:2.0-1 which is a higher version than

Then do the rest as above, except pysol is part of the same package as 
pysolfc.

I believe this is not as good since it's not really what epoch is meant 
for.
> And include an empty, separate, package for pysol.

pysol should not 
> be part of the same source as pysolfc).
But then I also need changelog, rules etc.
> (Note the extra packages I added to the conflicts.)
On Fri, 17 Sep 2010, Bernhard Reiter wrote:
>> And include an empty, separate, package for pysol.

pysol should not
>> be part of the same source as pysolfc).
> But then I also need changelog, rules etc.
I guess, but they are all empty, or boilerplate.
I found an example package for you: kernel-patch-debianlogo
On Fri, 17 Sep 2010, Bernhard Reiter wrote:
>> And include an empty, separate, package for pysol.

pysol should not
>> be part of the same source as pysolfc).
> But then I also need changelog, rules etc.
You can get standard boilerplate for rules from

/usr/share/debhelper/dh_make/debians/rules (although see the #name# 
replaceable vars in it, it might be easier to run dh_make -n -s, and copy 
the rules it makes).
I'm available to help (not a DD, though).

retitle 519752 ITP: pysolfc -- A Python solitaire game collection
owner 519752 !

I've uploaded a package version to mentors and am now looking for a
sponsor;

We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of
pysolfc, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:

A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is
attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.

If you
have further comments please address them to 519752@bugs.debian.org,
and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Bernhard Reiter <ockham@raz.or.at> (supplier of updated pysolfc package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;

if you
believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive
administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)

Maintainer: Debian Games Team <pkg-games-devel@lists.alioth.debian.org>
Changed-By: Bernhard Reiter <ockham@raz.or.at>
pysol      - transitional package from pysol to pysolfc

pysolfc    - collection of more than 1000 solitaire card games
Closes: 519752
- Moved Debian bug number from initial changelog entry to this one.
- Forgot to add a colon after "LP" in the inital changelog entry.
- Move python-pygame from Recommends to Depends.
- Make Debian Games Team the Maintainer, and myself an Uploader.
- Annotate cardsets entries with comments of their origins.
- Minor updates for current DEP-5 revision.

- Add override_dh_gencontrol section with some epoch magic
       to ensure proper upgrade path from pysol.

- Exclude COPYRIGHT files in individual cardset directories
       from installation.
* debian/patches/*: Remove # in front of comments.
* debian/patches/montana, debian/patches/series: Update patch, add to series.

* debian/patches/remove_checks_for_copyright_files, debian/patches/series:
     Remove checks for individual cardsets' COPYRIGHT files
which we remove in order to comply with Debian policy.
